Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary

Defying Gravity: Season 1 Livingston, Ron (Actor), Airlie, Andrew (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General ['Set in the very near future, eight astronauts from five countries undertake a mysterious six-year international mission on the spaceship Antares. This sexy and provocative sci fi thriller follows 4 men and 4 women through the solar system where their pasts reveal intimate and interconnected secrets that have a strange effect on the present and mysteries yet to be revealed. DVD includes 5 episodes never seen on television.'] {'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Yoba, Malik, Airlie, Andrew, Livingston, Ron', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '109899521990', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 19, 2010', 'Actors': 'Livingston, Ron, Airlie, Andrew, Yoba, Malik', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Number of discs': '4'} Good series, better on DVD w/o dumb commercials to interrupt.

Want show brought back!! Good series, better on DVD The Sound of Music Live! Carrie Underwood (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor), Beth McCarthy-Miller (Director), Rob Ashford (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees ["An aspiring nun in pre-WWII Austria leaves the abbey to become a governess for the widower Captain von Trapp's seven children and finds herself falling in love. Beloved worldwide, The Sound of Music includes unforgettable songs including “Edelweiss”, “Do-Re-Mi,” “My Favorite Things,” and “The Sound of Music”."] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '274264', 'Director': 'Beth McCarthy-Miller, Rob Ashford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Laura Benanti, Christian Borle, Audra McDonald', 'Producers': 'Priscilla Taussig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} There is a good reason why the original 1959 broadway version is basically lost to time and unknown while the movie version that followed is known to nearly everyone and widely beloved. The movie version rocks and the broadway version in comparision suxs.

Thus having painfully sat through this remake of the broadway version I will rate it a tedious and un-interesting if not embarrassing. Additionally the audio mix in the new one is terrible (or the lead has a very weak voice) and the stage is poor.

Overall nothing in this new version sparkles...I would rate it lower that a typical high school drama club presentation of Fiddler on the Roof...except here I no children I am related to to compele me to attend. And I am sorry I did. Poor at best... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'हिन्दी', 'मराठी', 'తెలుగు', 'Français', 'தமிழ்'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'ไทย', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）'], 'Directors': ['Gary Ross'], 'Producers': ['Nina Jacobson', 'Jon Kilik'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Lawrence', 'Josh Hutcherson', 'Liam Hemsworth'], 'Studio': ['SciFi and Fantasy']} I have to guess that I missed something.

Despite all the hype over this, I was just underwhelmed.

A very small story told even smaller. Very ordinary movie? {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Charles Beeson', 'Jeffrey G. Hunt', 'David Nutter', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Jeff Woolnough', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Holly Dale'], 'Studio': ['FOX']} TSCC is one of the best of TV and best of Sci-Fi genre. Highly recommend it.

Bummer that it was terminated after 2 seasons, but the writers did end it pretty well. I would love a few more seasons for sure.. I would give it 10 Stars {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chip Chalmers', 'Cliff Bole', 'David Carson', 'Gabrielle Beaumont', 'Michael Wagner', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Les Landau', 'Robert Legato', 'Robert Scheerer', 'Robert Wiemer', 'Shari Goodhart', 'Timothy Bond', 'Tom Benko', 'Winrich Kolbe'], 'Producers': ['Rick Berman', 'Michael Piller', 'Jeri Taylor'], 'Starring': ['Patrick Stewart', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Levar Burton'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} A good season. Nothing to really complain about. A good season. Interstellar (Blu-ray + DVD Combo Pack) Nolan, Christopher (Director), McConaughey, Matthew (Actor), Hathaway, Anne (Actor) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Oscar Central, Past Oscar Winners ['With our time on Earth coming to an end, a team of explorers undertakes the most important mission in human history; traveling beyond this galaxy to discover whether mankind has a future among the stars.'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Burstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, JessicaBurstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, Jessica See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '59165890000', 'Director': 'Nolan, Christopher', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 31, 2015', 'Actors': 'McConaughey, Matthew, Hathaway, Anne, Caine, Michael, Chastain, Jessica, Affleck, Casey', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '2'} Pretty meager as a full length feature movie. With editing it would pass muster as a ''Made for TV'' movie. Mathew is always compelling as an actor and worth a couple of tickets just to see his work. Pretty meager as a full length feature movie Focus (Blu-ray ) Will Smith (Actor), Margot Robbie (Actor) Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Comedy ['Focus (Blu-ray)', 'Will Smith stars as Nicky, a seasoned master of misdirection who becomes romantically involved with novice con artist Jess (Margot Robbie) as he’s teaching her the tricks of the trade.', ']]>'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Denise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian MartinezDenise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian Martinez See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'June 2, 2018', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '34050049', 'Director': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 2, 2015', 'Actors': 'Will Smith, Margot Robbie, Rodrigo Santoro, Gerald McRaney, Adrian Martinez', 'Subtitles': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Denise Di Novi, Charlie Gogolak, Stan Wlodkowski', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Number of discs': '1'} Great movie. But the action is fast and discreet so save movie until you are ready to really watch it closely. Both lead actors put in exceptional performances to say the least. Be sure to keep an eye on the gruffy old bouncer too. BTW; Ms Robbie is very pleasant visually and was surprisingly effective in this role (would not have minded seeing a lot more of her...;) Great Movie -- a must see Flight of the Navigator Joey Cramer (Actor), Veronica Cartwright (Actor), Randal Kleiser (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. After a mystifying disappearance, David returns, possessing vast, undiscovered knowledge about the farthest reaches of the universe. With these sudden navigational powers, David is able to take the fantastic flying machine anywhere he desires, accompanied by both its wisecracking robotic commander, Max, and an assortment of bizarre extraterrestrial creatures! Embark on a fun-filled, fast-paced journey of fantasy and adventure as David takes off on the flight of a lifetime! Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. (Ages 6 and older)", '--Lynn Gibson'] {'Genre': 'ACTION, Action/Adventure, LIVE', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howard Hesseman, Albie Whitaker, Iris Acker, Randal Kleiser, Joey CramerRichard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howar… See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.5 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2259724', 'Director': 'Randal Kleiser', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 1, 2004', 'Actors': 'Joey Cramer, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff De Young, Sarah Jessica Parker, Matt Adler', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Michael Burton, Matt MacManus', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Super movie. Kids and adults loved it (again). Great music (lots of beach boys tunes) will have the viewers of all ages toe tapping and dancing about. Super movie. Kids and adults loved it Cowboys & Aliens [Blu-ray] Daniel Craig (Actor), Harrison Ford (Actor), Jon Favreau (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['Product description', 'Cowboys & Aliens Blu-ray + DVD', 'Amazon.com', 'Cowboys & Aliens', "fuses rip-snortin' horse opera with some whiz-bang sci-fi, melding dry and austere badlands with slimy, mucusy aliens. Jake Lonergan (Daniel Craig, of James Bond fame) wakes up in the midst of sagebrush with a mysterious gadget around his wrist and no idea who he is--but he sure does remember how to take care of the bounty hunters who want to bring him in. His path soon crosses with a ruthless cattle baron named Woodrow Dolarhyde (Harrison Ford, of Indiana Jones fame), who's not too happy with Lonergan, who got Dolarhyde's son in trouble. But their fracas becomes beside the point when spaceships descend and start lassoing people like cattle. The humans, including a mysterious woman (Olivia Wilde,", 'Tron', '), a Native American tribe, and some snaggletoothed outlaws, band together to fight off this invasion from another world. The first two-thirds of', 'Cowboys & Aliens', "is peppy fun, with its tongue-in-cheek Wild West-ness and colorful supporting cast (including Sam Rockwell, Keith Carradine, Paul Dano, and Walton Goggins) and fairly understated CGI. The last third, with the obligatory assault on the alien vessel and a mess of clichés and inconsistencies, deflates a bit, which isn't surprising given that six screenwriters were involved. Director Jon Favreau (", 'Iron Man', ') does what he can to keep things lively. Fortunately, the good spirits of the first two-thirds will carry most viewers through to the end.', '--Bret Fetzer', 'Stills from', 'Cowboys & Aliens', '(Click for larger image)'] {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Action & Adventure/Thrillers, Westerns, Action & AdventureScience Fiction & Fantasy, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Action & Adventure/Thrillers, Westerns, Action & Adventure See more', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen, DTS Surround Sound, UltravioletMultiple Formats, Blu-ray, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen, DTS Surround Sound, Ultraviolet See more', 'Contributor': 'Buck Taylor, Harrison Ford, Jon Favreau, Abigail Spencer, Olivia Wilde, Noah Ringer, Daniel Craig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1), French Canadian (DTS 5.1), Spanish (DTS 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'May 2, 2016', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '6.75 x 5.4 x 0.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25192107184', 'Director': 'Jon Favreau', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen, DTS Surround Sound, Ultraviolet', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 6, 2011', 'Actors': 'Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Abigail Spencer, Buck Taylor, Olivia Wilde', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures', 'Number of discs': '2'} Decent movie...seems like a pilot for a TV series that didn't quite make it to the networks. Still it is worth a reasonable price. Note for 007 fans; yep he is in this one and does a straight up good job. Good Movie and a good boon for 007 fans. Hillary's America Digital Dinesh D'Souza (Actor, Director, Writer), Bruce Schooley (Director, Writer) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary ["Documentarian Dinesh D'Souza analyzes the history of the Democratic Party and what he thinks are Hillary Clinton's true motivations."] {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '43243136', 'Director': "Dinesh D'Souza, Bruce Schooley", 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 11, 2016', 'Actors': "Dinesh D'Souza", 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Gerald Molen', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Writers': "Dinesh D'Souza, Bruce Schooley", 'Number of discs': '1'} Great book. I am sending a copy to all my liberal associates so they can possibly finally, maybe get over losing the election. Great book. I am sending a copy to all my liberal associates!
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user continues to demonstrate a strong passion for sci-fi and character-driven narratives, appreciating complex interpersonal dynamics and thematic depth. Their discerning taste is evident in their critical reviews, where they acknowledge standout performances while expressing disappointment in storytelling quality, indicating a commitment to high-quality content.

Recently, the user showed versatility by engaging with a documentary that explores political themes, reflecting a broader interest in thought-provoking narratives beyond their typical sci-fi focus. Their enjoyment of both serious and lighter fare persists, with nostalgia shaping their viewing habits and prompting comparisons with new releases.

In a past interaction, the user purchased a sci-fi-western film, praising its fun elements while critiquing clichés in the latter half, underscoring their inclination towards adventurous narratives that balance entertainment and character engagement. They also appreciate familiar actors in unexpected roles, enhancing their viewing experience.

Though they occasionally critique contemporary works, their reviews reflect a commitment to meaningful storytelling that resonates with depth and complexity. The user favors immersive formats like Blu-ray for optimal quality and continues to blend nostalgia with a thoughtful approach to modern cinema, ensuring their media consumption remains intellectually fulfilling and emotionally resonant.
